content.description: Climb the face to the right of foxbite via a shallow left facing corner/flake.

Climb the crack a few moves until it ends, then traverse left on small horizontals and smaller feet to gain the right leaning ramp with a large undercling flake. Make a few moves straight up and make a difficult reach out left to gain another right leaning crack/flake system. Follow the jugs to the top.
content.protection: This climb has been led with tied-off hooks for pro. With normal pro, a fall from the low traverse would probably be a groundfall. It is realistically a toprope.
content.location: Start at an obvious crack a bit right of the center of the face that starts wide and quickly shrinks down in size.

content.description: Climb the right border of the cliff via the obvious crack/flake system. Any holds in the lichen above the crack are considered off route.
content.protection: The crack looks mostly shallow and flaring and difficult to find good gear. Small to medium cams and nuts fit in a few places. Given the traversing nature of the climb, directionals may be useful for toproping.
content.location: Start at the right edge off the cliff on big horizontal jugs.

content.description:
This is a 30ft tall, moderately overhanging cliff with a few nice routes on it. Morning shade/afternoon sun.

 For toproping, given the overhanging nature of the climbs, it may be worth lowering off and placing a directional so that the climber can easily regain the starting ledge while lowering off.
